ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy in Heritrix-2.0.0
ygData.msgSnippet: I was able to reproduce the problem starting from a working, nearly-default configuration and substituting BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy via the web UI s

From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy
 in Heritrix-2.0.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=BxJUe5y364D-oAHv2RwJYt_n4GwtMEezjbIX8ncOVIEh
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I was able to reproduce the problem starting from a working, 
nearly-default configuration and substituting 
BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy via the web UI's 'details' option for the 
'root: .

The problem appears to be that the definition of certain shared modules 
by name inside the root map -- specifically 'queue-assignment-policy' 
and then 'server-cache' -- is in a problematic order once a 
BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy is introduced.

The 'queue-assignment-policy' comes first and unlike other policies, 
BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy needs a reference to a ServerCache. There 
should only be one ServerCache, so an instance is created there, and all 
later ServerCache references should refer back to it. However, the 
immediately following 'server-cache' definition inside the 'root' map 
can't be filled by autowire references, as the exception indicates.

I'm not certain if that's a truly necessary restriction, but a 
workaround that removed the problem for me was to ensure that the 
'root:server-cache' definition comes right before, rather than right 
after, 'root:queue-assignment-policy'.

This can't be done via the web UI; I did it in the on-disk global.sheet 
before attempting to swap in BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy.

A small test crawl with BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy then launched and 
completed.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

Pratyush Banerjee wrote:
> 
> Hi Gordon,
> 
> Initially my application crashed due to selection of the 
> BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy. Obviously i had changed other default 
> options like the
> Archiver, and the politeness settings including max-retry and 
> retry-del;ay and fetch-http-timeout.
> 
> However after the application crashed i tried changing the 
> queueAssignmentPolicy in a frtesh installation of heritrix-2.0 and i 
> chose the profile basic-seed-sites crawl. But still the app crashed with 
> the same errors.
> 
> I also tried selecting optionally a BdbServerCache or a 
> DefaultServerCache along with the BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy but to no 
> avail.
> 
> Pratyush
> 
>
